factual: What happens to a conviction against a corporate legal entity after two years without committing any new criminal offence?
scenario_based: A company was convicted two years ago and hasn't been involved in any other crimes since then. Can its past conviction be expunged according to the law?
advice_seeking: As an executive of a corporation that has faced legal issues, what steps can I take to ensure my company's convictions are properly addressed under this provision?
